dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: From the troll?

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) One to fever, one to Wulfings, one to an iceberg turning. (beat) To sit in blood isn't every man's wish. If this Christ can stiffen Unferth's heart, what's the harm? As Unferth wades back toward the shore... ...Beowulf sees Hrothgar's despondency.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: They swim only out of fear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56 57 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 54.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Still... they swim. The two consider the dilemma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selma is alone in the field, picking herbs.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Dusk soon, eh. Selma turns, sees Beowulf some yards off. She fights her intrigue.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: You a herd dog? Beowulf, momentarily thrown, struggles up a grin.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Been called worse. I'm --

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Yes. The much-told hero from Geatland. In their glances there's obvious attraction, but both are cautious in the manner, reluctant to appear drawn. Selma turns back to her work. Beowulf edges closer.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I don't remember you. (off her look) From when I was young here.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: No. I came here in my teens. (pointed) A whore to Unferth's uncle, Alvis Three-Legs. (beat) Maybe I'm wrong. Maybe it was One. (off his look) Leg. Beowulf lets her grim quip have its moment.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: You're not then Dane? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57 Beowulf

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A silence. plants. & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 55. 57

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Oh I am. But my parents were killed by Wulfing raiders.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (bright) My father too... (corrects himself) .В»..not killed, I mean, but a feud with the Wulfings brought us here.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: (flat) It happens. I guess you weren't made a whore. He gets her point. Selma continues with picking

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I'm told you know of things to come.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: That's a wide sea.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Of the deaths of things.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Seeing that everything living dies, you still give me the sight of gods. (beat) Speak clean. You wonder of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: More of the troll.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: (dubious smile) Not of yourself?

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: In some things I'd rather be blind.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: You're worse than Loki with your sheepshit twining. We heard the hero of the Geats was blessed in flesh, but also thought. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 56

dialogues.speaker: SELMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (off his look) I say he dies, you likely live. I say he lives... She throws him a look. A silence. She relents.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: By Grid, you're the lamest blood- mighty I've met! (off his look / beat) The death of the troll will cost dear both the Geats and Danes... as it bloody well should.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Why as it should?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: The Danes have done their doom on him. And you come here to kill.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: We game our lives coming here. To help the Danes. You said you're Dane?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: I'm not a killer. Beowulf grabs hold of her arm, his anger rising. But she stares back at him, gives no physical resistance, only he eye.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (a warning) Many men wouldn't hold themselves.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Oh so you're a soft-heart too. Beowulf catches himself, releases her arm, and steps back

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Some men end up torn to bits. And eaten. Their heads used for bowling. Beowulf scowls, thrown by the weirdness of her warning.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Bowling? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 57.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Rolling a ball against standing cups... or - I dunno - skulls? The Saxons play it. But you're just a worm-eaten northern shit... so I guess you wouldn't know. Beowulf stares hard at her, but her gaze is more than a match. They're interrupted by Hondscioh and Breca riding up on horseback. Beowulf breaks eye contact with Selma, glances Hondscioh.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: The day's going down. If we want to be ready... Beowulf nods, and starts back toward the village.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Careful with what you don't understand. Beowulf turns, eyes her a beat, then continues on with hi boys. Once out of Selma's earshot, Hondscioh catches Breca's ey grins.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: That's one spooky Danish girl.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Y'ever heard of bowling? (off their looks) Something the Saxons do.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Wouldn't trust a Saxon as far as I could throw him.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: Y'ever met a Saxon?

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Knew someone who did. Hondscioh gives a SNORT of doubt. And the men continue on  58 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf, Hondscioh and Breca walk back through the villag .В»..and find the villagers in an improved mood. There ar CONVERSATIONS in the pathways, mild LAUGHTER... They pass the blacksmith's forge. The SMITH grins, waves a red-hot axe-head held in tongs. gives a forearm/fist of solidarity, and rams the axe-head down into the water bucket - bursting STEAM. The three Geats continue on... .В»..coming upon... .-+-Grimur who is whimpering, cornered into a section of barricade, holding up his arms to protect his bleeding he from stones thrown by a cluster of KIDS.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: Ho! The kids wheel, stones in hand. Seeing who it is, they ha a quick MUTTERING conference but back off a bit. One kid steps up.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Grimur's got a troll-heart! He brought Grannel here!

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Grannel?

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: The troll!

dialogues.speaker: GRIMUR
dialogues.text: (through bloody mouth) I'm a Dane and a Christian!

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Your mother screwed trolls!

dialogues.speaker: GRIMUR
dialogues.text: You little prick! Wild-eyed, Grimur staggers at the kid, who drills him in head with a stone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 59 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 59.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grimur screeches, falls to the ground, groaning and holdi his head. As the kid moves to give Grimur a kick, Beowulf steps bet them. He eyes the kids harshly... but the kid is as wild- eyed as Grimur.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: (tremulous ) Grannel killed my brothers! And Beowulf sees the rage in the child. He places his hug hand on the kid's trembling shoulder. Indicates Grimur.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: This wretch didn't. But we'll get the one that did. The kid meets Beowulf's eye. He calms, turns, leads his group away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Geat warriors prepare their troll-watch in the hal below... ..-.-Beowulf approaches Hrothgar on the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I didn't know this thing had a name. (off Hrothgar's look) Even the children know him - Grannel? Hrothgar gives a disinterested shrug.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Has this thing - this Grannel - killed any children? Hrothgar thinks a moment, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Women? (off Hrothgar's headshake) Old men... or men without war-gear?

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: What - you're thinking he fights with a clean heart? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 60

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I just --

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: (flaring) He kills the strongest first! He shows us he can kill the strongest! And who cares if he spares the children - they'll die anyhow without their fathers! A silence.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: My wits still war with how this all began.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Hate for the hall, I can only guess. The night we finished building it, the foul creep came. We hadn't seen a troll in fifteen... maybe twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: So nothing was done to this troll itself.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: (faintly irked) Beowulf! It's a fucking troll! Maybe someone looked at it the wrong way!

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (beat / soft) Some Dane? Hrothgar studies Beowulf with faint suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Who hands you this? Selma? (off Beowulf's look) She's been alone in the wilds too long. Her head's full of spiders, lap's full of moss.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: It's said she sees things. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 60 61 62 63 64 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 61.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: The crazy do. (beat) Listen, I never begged anyone to come here and take on our fight. I don't hold you here --

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: We came to help.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Then I beg you, don't saddle my heart with talk of why a troll does what it does. Hrothgar eyes the dimming horizon. Turns, squeezes Beowul shoulder, and starts down the steps back into the hall. Beowulf scans the ground, the darkness creeping from the rocks, but his heart remains unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS: the Geat warriors sprawled across the room, weapons at the ready. Breca, Hondscioh, Thorkel, Thorfinn eyes open - listen to the night. Several others are fighting drowsiness... ..-while Beowulf appears fully asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON: Beowulf as his eyes spring open. Otherwise, only his hand moves - taking grip of his sword. The CLATTER of something bouncing off the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf rises, sword drawn... his warriors also furtively reaching for weapons. Beowulf edges toward the door. Another CLATTER but this one to the side of the building. He tenses, puzzled, looks around at his band... A brief SILENCE... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 64 65 66 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 62.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: +..then another TAP/CLATTER - this one from the other sid As the men spread themselves about the space... ...there comes a FLURRY of things HITTING and BOUNCING of the ROOF. Beowulf takes up a torch, indicates for Hondscioh to open door. As Beowulf cocks back his torch-hand, ready to throw it.. Hondscioh and Breca throw open the doors... .-.to find nothing there but the dark. The band, led by Beowulf, nonetheless charges forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -..onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Watch the sides! As the men cautiously edge out... +--Beowulf looks down to find... .-..Numerous scattered stones and pebbles on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men move out several yards from the porch, then hold the ceremonial firepit, the darkness impenetrable any further... Hondscioh edges up beside Breca.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: Can we smell that bad? ON: Beowulf - the furthest out - a short distance from th rest of his crew. He stares into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Come on, crab slime, show me these teeth. Silence but for the wind in the hills... the darkness offering nothing else back... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 67 68 69 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 63.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: .-.the torch-lights flickering against the scare-hides, against the standing stones and boulders... EDGING IN ON: one of the boulders on which, gradually a f be made out - the faintly grinning face of Grendel - "playing" stone... -.-no Geat even aware of the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With FOG hanging over the village... Beowulf wanders along, brooding on the "peacefulness" of morning... ...-Danes seeming to be going about their business. He comes up to a firepit where Thorkel - harp in hand - i facing a small group of fascinated CHILDREN.

dialogues.speaker: THORKEL
dialogues.text: O'er the night, the warriors waited, / Sword and shield in ring- wrapped grip. / Then the fiend of bog and brine / Crept to those doors of ten men's weight, / Bade it creak with breath alone / But then smelt God amongst the men. / Hardly had they hoisted steel / Than the thing's rank guts gave out. / Great Beowulf, God's awful arm --

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (irked) Enough! Thorkel stops, turns, sees Beowulf...

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the children) Go off now! And the children scurry off. Thorkel eyes Beowulf harshly

dialogues.speaker: THORKEL
dialogues.text: You scare them doing that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 69A
dialogues.text: Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 64.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: oO fuck, Thorkel! They've only had months of waking to the scattered parts of kin! Don't feed them lies. That was piss the other night - piss on us. If any gods were there, they were sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: THORKEL
dialogues.text: (hesitant) The Celt says Jesus Christ never sleeps, that he walks amongst us even now.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, that's all we need. A god gone mad from lack of sleep. Thorkel shrugs, strums his harp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON: Hrothgar slumped on his throne, staring grimly into t otherwise empty space of the hall. WITH: Beowulf edging through the door, seeing Hrothgar. Beowulf crosses the hall toward him... ..+-Hrothgar breaking from his stupor.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: I built this hall to be my home. Not the stinking grave of my people. Maybe it should just burn down. A silence. Beowulf considers the handsome hall.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I don't know what else we can do. He comes here, throws his stones, pisses, goes. If I knew what steers his mind --

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Beowulf! What steers the mind of a Slav? What steers the mind of a Wulfing? They want what's yours so you have to cut their heads in half or else they take it! We're not talking great thinkers here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oe OO

dialogues.speaker: 69B
dialogues.text: Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 65.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hrothgar studies Beowulf - seeing his ambivalence.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Something has you turning.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I fear the troll just waits for us to go.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Same thought gnaws on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf walks along the edge of the village, looking over -..some Geats making adjustments to their weapons... .В»..one mending his jerkin... .--another whittling a fish from wood. He passes an old shed, only to find... ..-Thorkel on the other side having sex with a young Dani WIDOW. Beowulf watches a moment more than he otherwise might... briefly transfixed... before Thorfinn turns and sees him. Beowulf turns away... -.-.continues on over to a field... ..-where Breca and Hondscioh are practicing sword-play. But the two of them are in very different worlds: Breca i fighting with spectacularly flashy great swings of his gr blade... whereas Hondscioh seems lost in thought - matter factly blocking Breca's strokes, but making no advances o his own. Breca stops, indicates Hondscioh to Beowulf.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: He's already fighting like a Dane.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: You want to waste your strokes on me and the air - go ahead. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 66.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beowulf steps up, unsheathes his sword. Breca takes sparr position... and they begin trading loose strokes.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: (mocking) Hondscioh had a bad dream. Beowulf glances at Hondscioh, giving this more respect th Breca is willing to. Hondscioh shakes his head, dismissiv

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (to Breca) And yours were good? A trading of swordstrokes. Breca shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here with the smoke of the dead? Breca gets the shot. Takes a heavy swing at Beowulf which Beowulf blocks.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: I don't see fear helping us.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: Don't you fucking start --

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Fear, eh... And Beowulf takes a couple fierce swings at Breca, under which Breca staggers back. The two stare at each other a beat - fire in their eyes. And Breca strides forward swinging his blade as to cut through trees. Beowulf - seeing the power - keeps back, t Breca has spent some of his emotion. Then Beowulf counters, knocking Breca back till he tumble over some uneven ground. Beowulf stands over him, his blade raised.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Careful you don't drop it.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (soft) Fear has its place. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 71 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 67.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He lowers his blade, calms, offers Breca a hand up. Breca after a beat, accepts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf edges along on horseback, eyeing the rocky outcro with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selma is cooking at her fire-pit. Beowulf rides up, surprising her, but she quickly masks i

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: How did you find me?

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Most Danes seem to know the way.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Most don't have the guts these days. She studies his face, sees a wildness in his eye, resigns herself. She puts down the utensils, turns her back to him, spread her legs slightly, hikes up her skirt, and bends over aga a railing, offering herself. Beowulf struggles with his urge.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's butter in the bowl, if you need it. Beowulf averts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I wondered if you threw the stones. Selma straightens up, drops her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Rune-stones. (off his nod / sardonic) Oh no, you don't fear your fate.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: My weird is my own, that's not what I ask. I need the right path. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 72 73 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 68.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: There is the one that leads back to Geatland.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: If the stones say so.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: And what if I lie?

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Then the gods will bring me back. It's both a warning and a promise.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: So. No thoughts at all for my cunt. Beowulf looks off: it's not the word he needs to hear rig now.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Warrior-monk, not many of those. She studies him a beat, then turns and she goes into her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selma sits on the floor, leaning over the rune-stones as shakes them, throws them, and then considers. Beowulf sits opposite, transfixed by what the V in her neckline reveals of her chest.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: The answer's in the stones, not my breasts. She looks up at him. He awkwardly shrugs - caught. There comes agitation from the HORSES outside, STOMPING t dirt, NEIGHING. An eerie WHISTLING. Beowulf stands, and draws his sword. He eyes her a beat. She looks back down to her stones. And he strides out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-into the yard, where he scans the now-misty periphery. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 73 74 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 69.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Glimpsing a huge dark FIGURE running into the mist. Beowulf watches a moment - in obvious awe - then rushes t his horse, and mounts it. But, in turning to mount the horse, he finds... ...the figure already lost from view. Nonetheless, he edges off in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf rides along, though cautiously, due to the mist. Shapes can be vaguely made out... suggestions of movement but they're unresolved, indefinite - keeping Beowulf on h guard. There comes a weird unsettling LAUGH... then the sound of FALLING SCREE to one side... --.and Beowulf veers off the trail... -..coming to a slope which leads up to a more sheer rock- face. At his feet, dust from the stone-fall is only start to settle. Selma rides up beside him. Beowulf gives her a wary look.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Was this in the rune-stones? Selma shakes her head - but in exasperation, not confirmation. Beowulf dismounts and starts up the scree-ridden slope.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: That's less than wise.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (hint of suspicion) So your stones say?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: They don't need to. Most could see... to climb shifting scree at dusk... in mist... unless of course you're a hero... Beowulf stares up into the mist. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 70.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WITH: Grendel, perched in a seemingly inaccessible crag, berry-bush in hand from which he plucks berries and eats them.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (shouts) Grannel! Leave here... or stay and meet your doom!

dialogues.speaker: GRENDEL
dialogues.text: (weary mutter) ++-doom doom doom doom... WITH: Beowulf trying to make out the sound.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: It's Grendel. Not Grannel.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (xe Grendel's noises) Is that talk?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Well it isn't barking. A low rumble of a garbled MUTTER [in Old Norse/Icelandic] from above. Selma smirks.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: He offers you the same. (off his look) You can leave or meet your doom. (beat) You're not Dane. That's why you still breathe. WITH: Grendel...

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I'm blood-bound to Hrothgar!

dialogues.speaker: GRENDEL
dialogues.text: (to himself / mocking) ---blood blood blood... Grendel gathers up some stones from between his feet. He GROWLS out a terse phrase to Beowulf. WITH: Beowulf looking to Selma for translation. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 75 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 71.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Says that's your burden. Beowulf's temper frays, he raises his sword at the rock-f

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: My burden is your stinking life! A silence... then the handful of stones come down upon Beowulf's helmet, infuriating him more.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Come down here, I swear I'll hammer these stones right up your hairy arse! A long MUTTER, and Selma tries her hardest not to laugh. Beowulf stares at her, impatient for the translation.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: He says that might help. He's had a hard time shitting since the last Dane he ate. The sound of shifting scree... and Beowulf raises his sword... eyeing the mist for a discernible shape. But nothing comes. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Why won't he fight me?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Why should he? You've done nothing to him. Selma turns her horse and starts back down the path. Beow looks - from her - back up into the darkening rock-face, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf rides into the camp to find... -..Selma stirring up the embers of her firepit. Beowulf dismounts, edges over to her.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: What was he doing at your hut? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 72

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Selma gives a faintly contemptuous look, but it's met by Beowulf's own look - one carrying a scary volatility.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: I forgot. You're the great Geat - welcome to women wherever you go. Swimmer of oceans... able to kill five Swedes in a stroke of his great blade...

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I only came to help the Danes find peace.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: I'm Dane. I'm at peace. Not that I always was. (beat) When Alvis Three-Legs died in my bed, some - like Unferth - claimed * I killed him with a drink. They burned my hut, drove me to the wilds. Then they'd only come around to maybe spill some seed.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Unferth too? *

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Unferth leading. *

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: They still come?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Not since Grendel.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Grendel. What sort of name -- *

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Means "grinder." *

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Of bones?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: of teeth. He was born with bad dreams. Beowulf gives a skeptical look. Selma shrugs: believe it not. * (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 76 77 78 79 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 73.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nothing I say will help you kill him. Beowulf studies her - sees the challenge - and her witchy beauty in the falling light.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep to the path. Try not to fight with the moss. Selma crosses the threshold into the hut, lights a lamp, takes off her cloak. She turns in the doorway and her breasts shift noticeably beneath the worn-thin cloth of h blouse. She stares back at Beowulf a beat, then closes th door. The sound of a WOODEN LATCH falling into place. Beowulf, both stunned and aroused, turns and mounts his horse, eyes the falling dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf rides along, warily... .--while above, in the boulders, Grendel scrambles, smili keeping pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON: Beowulf sitting before the fire-pit, staring into the embers. Around him, all the Geat warriors sleep. For the first ti seeming peace. Beowulf's gaze is fixed on the great doors on which shado gently shift, suggesting figures, ghosts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warriors jerk awake, scan around - no damage, sunligh streaming through the door... ...and, in a corner, Beowulf soundly sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With sunlight streaming in through the smoke-hole... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 74.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ...-Hrothgar leans forward against the wall, pissing into bucket. He winces, eyes closed, sweat on his forehead. Finished, looks down, and - as quickly - jerks his gaze away.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: (tremulous whisper) Fuck me... He takes up the bucket, starts out of the room, when... ...Wealhtheow comes in with a pitcher and cups. She immediately sees his state. She looks to the bucket, but pushes past her. Panic rises in her.

dialogues.speaker: WEALHTHEOW
dialogues.text: Hrothgar?

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: It's age. Nothing more.

dialogues.speaker: WEALHTHEOW
dialogues.text: Stay. Hrothgar puts the bucket out of the room, turns back to h

dialogues.speaker: WEALHTHEOW
dialogues.text: (persuading herself) You don't go in pain. You go in peace. Happy...

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Happy. (forced laugh) Well, then... I'm not going anywhere today. (beat) Who says this? Selma. (off Wealhtheow's silence) Odin wishes me no peace. (long beat) She said I die happy. Wealhtheow nods. Hrothgar shakes his head, trying to fath the thought.  80 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: a hnaftafl board [Norse chess-like game] with B and Hondscioh sitting on opposite sides: there are about dozen light players surrounded by a besieging force of tw dark players, a light king-figure in the center of the bo WIDE/REVEAL: Beowulf and a few Geats standing nearby watching.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: So long as the king wins the day. The Geats turn to see Hrothgar shuffle up, with an amiabl grin.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: Always, my Lord. Hrothgar pats Beowulf's shoulder, leads him away from the others.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: So... another bloodless night. (off Beowulf's nod) Well, for you... at any rate. Beowulf ponders the cryptic comment. Hrothgar makes sure none of the others are close enough to hear.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: I'm pissing it.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (after a puzzled beat) Blood?

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: (nods/shrugs ) It's come and gone over the months. (forced grin) I'm turning to a woman. Or a dying man. Beowulf gathers his words.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Last night I talked with him. Hrothgar looks at him, not getting the sense. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 76.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Grendel...

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: (stunned) You talked?

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: If you can trust what Selma says. Hrothgar considers this a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He stayed above me in the rocks. But it was a voice... speaking words. He only wants Danes. He blames you for something. Hrothgar almost chokes on this.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: He blames me! Of all the shit! (fierce mutter) What the fuck they think -- Hrothgar stops himself. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are coves north of here no Dane even dares to go! How much land does one mouth need? What's he think - he's a fucking troll Caesar - with rights to everything he looks upon?! (indicating the mountains) We roamed the seas, I will say that. But up there, that rock and ice, we never found the need to go. I didn't go knocking down his door! The two men brood on this a beat. Hrothgar sighs to calmness.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Word on the waves is I die happy. (off Beowulf's look) No gods I know have offered me that. No. Mine just offer beer, a fish here and there... and friends to burn. (beat /overwhelmed) (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 81 82 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 77.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's hard to hold you talked with that fucker.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: He talked... from well beyond my sword. But it's clear in Hrothgar's look that he senses Beowulf knows more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON: Hrothgar, solemn, to his waist in the river... WIDE/REVEAL: Brendan raising a handful of water and touch Hrothgar's in the sign of the cross... MUTTERING LATIN as does... As Brendan turns back to the shore... ..-Hrothgar remains, and turns to the deeper water.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: (a mutter) Bless me... or be done... and drown me in blood. WIDE ON: many DANES on the shore watching the ritual. CLOSE ON: Beowulf and Hondscioh, watching with clearly mi emotions.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: Great. Now we get a pissed-off Odin.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Or maybe no one up there at all.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: (fierce, superstitious) Don't say that! What's in your head?! (off Beowulf's look) I don't game my blood for last night's beer. The two eye each other. Beowulf shrugs retraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Beowulf and his men work on their boat... stitching th sail, adding pitch to the seams... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 83 84 85 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 78.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ...Grimur approaches, healed, but still showing the scabs from his wounds, and edges up to Beowulf.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMUR
dialogues.text: I owe you for sparing me from those stones. I can lead you to the Dane- killer's cave. Beowulf is stunned by the offer.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Grendel? (off his nod / wary) Why didn't you before?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMUR
dialogues.text: I feared all things... its wrath... my death. He holds up a cross on a chain around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No more. Grimur gives a happy smile. Beowulf masks his ambivalence

dialogues.speaker: DA
dialogues.text: Beowulf's ship moves along the shore, Grimur scanning the rocks. As Beowulf looks out over the open water...

dialogues.speaker: GRIMUR
dialogues.text: There. Beowulf turns to see... .--.Grimur pointing to a break in the rocks. The helmsman leans against the rudder and the boat turns toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grimur leads the crew up over treacherous rocks towards.. В«..an entrance in the cliffside. They light up torches, in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they edge into the darkness... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 86 87 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 79.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: .-.their torches flicker and HISS in the oozy damp. Hondscioh takes several steps forward... .В»..and the ground goes out below him. As Hondscioh fall ...Beowulf lunges forward and grabs his cloak... the othe behind Beowulf grabbing hold of him to keep him secure. They pull Hondscioh back up from the fathomless dark belo

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: (to Grimur) I guess you didn't know that was there.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMUR
dialogues.text: I swear - by Christ --

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: Let's leave Christ out of this. Hondscioh takes a torch and throws it down into the dark. After only a few seconds it hits rock, and skitters onto ground which it briefly illuminates before CRACKLING out.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: (to Beowulf) Not far... but we'll need ropes, hooks, more torches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the troop exits the cave... ..-Breca turns back, undoes his pants, and pisses across rocks at the entrance. LAUGHTER from almost all the Geats. Beowulf manages a smile, until his gaze meets... ..-Grimur, whose face betrays worry at this act. Grimur turns and hurries down the rocks towards the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the men near their waiting ship... ..-Beowulf, sensing something, hangs back, but does not t (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 88 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 80.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He kneels down, appears to adjust a leather thong on his shoe. Abruptly he wheels around to see... .+--a small FERAL child - dark and hairy - staring back a though frozen by being seen. Their gazes hold several bea before the child slips from sight behind boulders. Beowulf glances back towards his company... all of whom w oblivious to the sighting. Beowulf turns back to the rocks... .--catches his breath, gaze scanning over the forbidding scape.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The men are buoyant - again, all but Beowulf and Grimur a the rear of the boat, who scan the shore.

dialogues.speaker: THORKEL
dialogues.text: -..so they came to the cave of the killer / But found it fled, their weapons's work / Undone by dark and the slime of slope. / Hondscioh nearly fell to Valhalla --

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: Let's uh... let this sad tale sleep.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Hondscioh shows up - great Odin and the others ask how he died, and Hondscioh goes - I uh... fell? ROARS of LAUGHTER from the group. Hondscioh eyes Thorkel.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: You better find a better line. As Breca, at the boat's bow, leans back, pulling hard on oar... .---a huge creature HAND rises out of the water, bronze a ring flashing in the light, grabs Breca by the hair, and starts yanking him over. His oar slams into the other in front of him, alerting th men. Thorfinn, beside him, snatches hold of his legs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 89 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 81.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The tug is strong, and Breca's head dips below the surfac As Beowulf rushes the length of the boat... ..-Hondscioh, nearer Breca, grabs an oar, and rams it repeatedly down into the water below Breca. The creature - hit - loosens its grip, and shifts under t boat, a mass of long, tangled head-hair trailing... till disappears below. The men haul the unconscious Breca back onto the ship... ...to find bleeding gouges in his shoulder and a tear in scalp. Beowulf, spear in hand, stares down into the water, ready strike... .--but there's nothing more to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Geats are bedding down... ..-Breca - bandaged and grinning - sits before the fire.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Even the trolls want my beautiful hair.

dialogues.speaker: THORFINN
dialogues.text: I think he wanted you for more than that. LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: Great Breca, the Troll-house Pisser! I'd be more careful where I wave my spear.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: I'd piss in his mouth if he dared to show it.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Best be ready to do more than that. The mood shifts, all eyes turning to Beowulf.  90 o1 92 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf sits just outside the door, waiting, listening to SOUNDS of the night -- wind, old songs, the sea, laughter His eyelids grow heavy. He drifts off... ...into a vision: of the feral boy standing before him. T child hands him a huge sword, which Beowulf takes. The boy then opens his shirt, exposing his tiny chest. He looks from the sword to Beowulf and nods: go on. Beowulf - heavy-eyed - watches him a beat, blinks, jolts awake to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В«--the glare of daylight. Silent villagers surround him, puzzling over the tableau: Further down the steps lies the CORPSE of Grimur, his hea still on, but twisted backwards. ON: Beowulf, as the shock settles in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf and his warriors are loading their weapons, as we as ropes, poles and iron hooks, onto the ship. Unferth rides up on a horse. Beowulf considers him coolly

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Seems Grendel doesn't mind killing Christians... so long as they're Dane.

dialogues.speaker: UNFERTH
dialogues.text: Can another sword help? Beowulf studies him a beat. Walks up to his side.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Hrothgar's told me about you and trolls. (off Unferth's embarrassment) You back me up, you back me up. Fall away on me, I'll kill you myself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92 93 94 95 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 83.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Unferth stares steady at Beowulf, then nods. Beowulf nods back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With thrown-down torches lighting them from below... ..-the warriors descend by ropes into the cavern...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apprehensive warriors, armed with swords, shields, spears, edge through the damp, stinking place... Animal and fish carcasses are scattered about. Each DRIP of water makes someone turn... Some simple tools... a pile of wood and a fire-pit... but the torches reach the corners of the cave... no Grendel. Beowulf slumps back against a wall, sighs - relief and frustration tangled in a mess in his head. Hondscioh comes upon a small alcove, and discovers within it... CLOSE ON: the desiccated HEAD of Grendel's father. Hondscioh stares in a mix of horror and wonder, then take up by the long braided hair, holds it out before the othe to see...

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH
dialogues.text: Look! Our friend Grendel doesn't come from mist and shit alone. As the warriors all watch, fascinated... .--Hondscioh throws the huge head into the air, then - as falls - he smashes it through with one great swing of his axe. Eyes wild, he then smashes the sections into even smaller pieces. He stops, catches his breath. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 96 97 98 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 84.

dialogues.speaker: HONDSCIOH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (soft) I curse you and all your kin. He looks up and finds Beowulf's troubled gaze. There's something terrible in what he's done - and they are both terribly aware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men finish piling dry grass and sticks around a great hunk of driftwood in the cave entrance. Unferth moves forward torch in hand.

dialogues.speaker: UNFERTH
dialogues.text: (fanatical) For all who've died by the demon's hand! Beowulf trades a glance with Breca: who is this madman?.. ..-after which Unferth throws the torch upon the pile. The men watch the fire rise quickly up around the wood... smoke twisting down into the cave.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The ship moves along... half the men rowing... the others scanning the water, spears in hand ready to strike at anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selma is chopping firewood as... .--Beowulf rides up and dismounts. His aspect is grim. Selma struggles to mask her apprehension.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: So... is it done?

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: He wasn't in his cave. (beat / a demand) How does he die? Selma gives an ambiguous shrug, keeps chopping wood. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 85.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beowulf moves toward her, and she wheels, the axe raised ready to throw. Beowulf stops.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Unless your teeth can catch an axe... Beowulf softens his manner.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I led my men into this... not knowing. If I'd known, I'd've come alone. I see doom hanging over some of them now. Doom I brought. Selma considers his concern, lowers the axe.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: You found the cave. (beat / hesitant) That's where I see him... dying.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: And he wasn't there.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Would you sit in your cave and wait for killers who knew the path to your door? A silence. Beowulf slumps back against a fish-drying rack

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: What do you know of Christians? The question catches her off-guard. She considers a momen

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: They're looking for a father.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: What's wrong with Odin?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Odin gets drunk. Wrecks the house. Beowulf nods. As she puts down the axe, and reaches for wood... .-..-Beowulf lunges forward and grabs her by the arm. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 99 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 86.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Take me to Grendel.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: What? - y'think I can sniff him down?

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Maybe not, but he can sniff you. Beowulf steers her over to his horse, grabs a rope and bi her arms to her sides. Selma gives minimal resistance, seeming more bored than anything with the exercise. Beowulf lifts her onto her own horse, grabs its reins, mo his horse, and leads them off down the trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf and Selma arrive at the rockface up which Grendel previously lurked. Beowulf dismounts, turns to the rockfa

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: What's the way up from here?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Straight... but you'd need claws. Beowulf looks at her darkly, circles. Selma gives him an ever-so-faintly-contemptuous look.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Then again, heroes -- He turns on her, volatile, barely in control. She almost snarls:

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: You hit me, I'll be the one -- She stops herself, but Beowulf's heard enough to wonder.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: One to what? Selma looks away. Beowulf takes out his knife. He looks like he could do anything with it. For the first time she looks unsure. But he pulls her around and cuts the lash from her wrists (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 100 101 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 87.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: I can't stop his death from coming... nor can I hurry it.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: He needs to know... I know he was wronged. But if he comes to us again, there's nothing I --

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: (ironic) You're warning him. Beowulf studies her a beat, then remounts his horse.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Careful which side you end up on. You're a long way from the village.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: You're a longer way from home. Beowulf eyes her a beat, then turns and rides off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the smoky cave, Grendel comes staggering, coughin squinting through the stinging haze... He drops to his knees, continues along... Finally his extended hand comes upon the now-empty alcove He twists about, hands then desperately searching the nea ground. One hand clutches something, brings it up into his sight. CLOSE ON: one half of the facial portion of his father's skull. Grendel gasps, brings the piece to his face, sniffs it, a his eyes go hard. He emits a long HOWL - an eerie mix of sorrow and rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel, eyes wet, sits and KEENS, banging two rocks agai each other in a hypnotic rhythm... his hands bloodied in process. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 102 103 104 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 88.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He comes to the end of his song, and his hands drop weari to his sides. He heaves the bloody rocks into the sea... .-..wipes the blood from his hands across his face - in warrior-mask... ...then turns and fixes for a last time on the setting su

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Hondscioh asleep on the next bench over... ..-Beowulf lies on his, tired eyes on the rafters, edging sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silence of the night. PAN DOWN: the outer stone perimeter... to a GUARD impaled a wooden spike. And Grendel continues through the boulders,, the blood ca heavy on his face, his eyes wide, almost trance-like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silence... then the very faint sound of BREATHING the other side of the doors. The oak doors begin to creak... with an awesome and stead pressure. As the doors bend in... .--Beowulf twists toward them. There's resignation on his face: his fate shall now come. He takes his battle breath

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Wake up, men, or never again! There's the sudden CRACK of splitting wood, and the doors securing beam snaps apart. The warriors leap up, taking hold of weapons. The doors fly open and Grendel - silhouetted - charges in Beowulf, no weapon in hand, rushes toward him... ..-but Grendel, as quickly, shifts into the darkness. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 89.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Beowulf turns frantically about, fearful for his men, searching out the form through the confusion of them scrambling for their weapons... ...Grendel shifts past him, snatches up the still-blinkin Thorkel - sniffs him - not what Grendel is looking for. Grendel flings him to one side... ...reaches and snatches up the next one - Hondscioh. As Hondscioh struggles to get his sword in play, Grendel pulls Hondscioh's other hand to his face, sniffs him once make sure...

dialogues.speaker: GRENDEL
dialogues.text: (soft / in old Norse/Icelandic) For my father. ...then deftly snaps his neck. ON: Beowulf turning just in time to see... and his horror gives way to fury. As Beowulf charges towards him... ..-Grendel twists around and throws Hondscioh's corpse at him, knocking him down. As Beowulf struggles out from the grim embrace of his dea friend... ..-Grendel reaches for Breca, but a sword swings down and slashes Grendel across the upper arm. Grendel, seething, turns to find... ..-Unferth there, bringing back his sword for another swi

dialogues.speaker: UNFERTH
dialogues.text: By Christ, demon, you shall die! But before he can swing his sword... ...Grendel backhands him, sending him flying against the outer wall. Grendel reaches again for Breca... but his arm is waylaid CLOSE ON: a fierce handgrip upon his wrist. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oe OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 90.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He turns and sees the wild-eyed gaze of Beowulf... as Beowulf's other hand grabs Grendel by the hair and tugs b his neck. A spear, thrown by a Geat, slams against Grendel's chest bounces off. Beowulf, tugging Grendel into the torchlight only then sees... .-+-the iron-mail-shirt binding Grendel's torso. Grendel stares into Beowulf's face. They're frozen for a moment... ...there's almost sadness - wonder - in their looks... +..then Grendel throws back his arm - Beowulf still attac and the two tumble back against the wall. They wrestle across the floor, tumble over benches, throu tables... ...the other Geat warriors circling, weapons raised to strike. But the target is impossible to fix on... the two figures Grendel and Beowulf - twisting about as one. Finally Grendel smashes Beowulf against the wall, and get free of one of Beowulf's hands. He turns toward the door, meaning to escape, but finds... ---.a massive fishing NET dropped across the exit, and, between it and him, a cluster of strong and determined Ge standing with spears and shields levelled at him... ---but, worse than that, Beowulf is still holding on. Grendel smacks Beowulf again against the wall, forcing Beowulf's grip to loosen. Grendel tugs free... --.and scrambles up the wall like a monkey to the second floor. Beowulf, with blood gushing from his face, runs up the st after him. Grendel, finding the upper balcony door bolted, smashes a till it starts to give way. But then Beowulf is once again upon him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 105 106 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 91.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With one hand Grendel smashes at the door, the other struggling to throw off Beowulf. Grendel charges the door with his shoulder, and it gives bringing them out into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В«--the night. As Grendel, dragging Beowulf, struggles to the railing... ...Beowulf frees one of his hands long enough to snatch h of a hanging rope, which he then deftly knots about the w of Grendel's already-gouged-and-bleeding arm. Grendel swings wildly back with his other arm, but Beowul avoids it... though he lets go his grip. Grendel snarls, then vaults over the railing... ..-but drops only a few feet before the rope snaps taut, full weight wrenching down on the shoulder joint. A sickening POP as the arm dislocates from the socket. He SCREECHES pain... ON: Beowulf wincing at the scream... * CLOSE ON: the shoulder muscles, already cut, continue to shift and TEAR from the strain... .---and he twists in the air, suspended several feet abov ground. Beowulf brings up a spear, is trying to line it up for a death-throw... * ..-but Grendel continues to twist too wildly. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Geat warriors spill out through the doorway, they just as quickly mesmerized... ..-by Grendel twisting above them. Several warriors hurl their spears up at him. One or two ricochet off his mailshirt, one lodges in his hip. Grendel wrenches the spear out of his flesh, in turning, fixes on... * (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 106 107 108 109 110 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 92.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: .--Beowulf, leaning wounded on the balcony, torn gaze fix on Grendel. Grendel manages something most resembling a shrug, then fiercely jams the spear point back in - this time, at the muscle and sinew of his distended shoulder. The spear-gouge does its work: the flesh finally shreds, arm tearing off from the shoulder... ..-and Grendel drops in a heap to the ground. The warriors freeze, staring. Grendel struggles to his feet, turns on them - SCREECHES then, with his other hand clasped across the pouring woun charges through the standing warriors - bowling several o and continues off into the darkness... ..-those left standing too mesmerized to pursue him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf, also bleeding profusely, undoes the rope...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ---and the gory trophy of the ARM drops to the ground. The warriors edge up to it, in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel stagger/weaves on through the night, weakening wi blood-loss, his breaths coming in gasps... the ROAR of th sea rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel comes through rocks, out onto the pebble beach. H staggers forward, tumbles to his knees, rises... staggers several blind steps more... until his feet reach the wate and only then does he let his legs come to rest. He's almost falling as he stands, blood draining into the water. He stares up into the starry sky - knowing it's the last - blinks, desperately struggling to focus. A kind of wond sweeps over him, relief, a sad smile... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 111 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 93.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ..-he shudders, eyes close, bloody hand drops to his side and he falls into the surf... ---his body limp, cradled by the waves. Something then shifts through the water to one side of hi Another arm - much like his - breaks the surface, reaches takes hold of Grendel's shoulder, and pulls him down belo the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a couple of warriors carry Hondscioh's body out... * ...Beowulf, surrounded by Breca and several other Geats, watch from their horses. Hrothgar approaches, eyes Hondscioh's corpse. *

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Now you truly know our loss. Beowulf edges out of hearing of the others.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: You only gave us half the tale.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: The other half would dull your sword. Beowulf dismounts, eyes Hrothgar evenly. *

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: That troll didn't give a shit about us, not until we wronged him. He killed one. He could've killed more. He killed the one he held in blame. * Hrothgar meets Beowulf's look, sighs, lets the door open.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Were it so easy... I'd have been * the one. * (off Beowulf's look) * I killed his father. * (beat) * (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111 112 113 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 94.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And even that might have been an end... had it just been the father there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The same cliffs from the opening sequence. ] Hrothgar raises up his battle-mask, holds up his torch, p down into the rocks... and sees... CLOSE ON: the face of the tiny troll-child - Grendel - shuddering with fear, staring up. Hrothgar's breath catches in his throat. He stares a mome more... ...then he heaves his torch off the cliff, as far out in sea as he can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hrothgar's expression echoes that of the memory: one of puzzlement... but now deepened with guilt and regret.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: None of the others saw the child. (beat / shrugs) I could've quelled it there and then... but weakness stopped my spear.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Or kindness.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Then it's the hardest kindness I know. Hrothgar reaches under his shirt and brings out a Christi erucifix and his Thor-hammer pendant - each on its own si chain. Considers them both.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And now all gods run from me as though I were the death itself. Hrothgar turns and walks toward the mead hall entrance, Beowulf following. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113 114 115 116 117 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 95.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: So what had the father done? Why did you kill him? Hrothgar continues toward the hall, brooding on the quest He stops in the shadow of the doorway, struggling. And then he continues in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON: Hrothgar and his weary mind.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: He crossed our path. The pathetic pettiness of Hrothgar's answer sweeps over h before he speaks it:

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He took a fish. Hrothgar looks to Beowulf, then gazes up to the central rafter... .--.onto which several Danes are mounting Grendel's arm: roping it up then driving spikes through it to hold it to beam.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: We'll follow the blood trail. Make sure it's done. Hrothgar nods... and Beowulf withdraws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf and his warriors follow the blood-trail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +-+.to the cove in the rocks traversed by Grendel. CLOSE ON: the twisting blood-trail through the sand and stones, ending at the hide-tide line. Beowulf and Breca stand together, Thorfinn just back of t others nearby. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 117 118 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 96.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Without an arm...

dialogues.speaker: THORFINN
dialogues.text: Unless it grows back. (off Beowulf's look) He's a troll. Beowulf musters all the patience he can.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Tell me, Thorfinn. What's a troll? Thorfinn shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: THORFINN
dialogues.text: I've just always liked to put my foot on a kill. Make sure it isn't still moving. (off their looks) They say there are lizards that grow back limbs. They say there are worms that grow back heads.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: This is no more worm than you or I.

dialogues.speaker: THORFINN
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I'd fight with one arm. ON: Beowulf's ambivalent look. 117 He gazes down into the water - which offers no certainty anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 CLOSE ON: Grendel's great [and gory] arm nailed to the en rafters. ON: Beowulf looking up at the arm, Aeschere beside him

dialogues.speaker: AESCHERE
dialogues.text: (discreet) I don't know if that's the thing. (off Beowulf's look) To nail it up. (beat) No good comes from gloating. Beowulf nods, shrugs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WIDE/REVEAL: the hall full of Danes and Geats, drinking a feasting in celebration... ...and, beside Beowulf, a pile of gifts: a great gold ban a glimmering mail-shirt, an ornate sword... It's a raucous party, a vent for the fear that's hung ove these people, a loud celebration of the relief they now f WITH: a half-drunk Unferth leaning in to Brendan who - th also tipsy - is tiring of Unferth's confession.

dialogues.speaker: UNFERTH
dialogues.text: I've put my thing in other men's wives, other men's daughters...

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: It all can be forgiven.

dialogues.speaker: UNFERTH
dialogues.text: I slept with a witch - that's gotta be bad...

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: (thrown) You slept with a witch?

dialogues.speaker: UNFERTH
dialogues.text: Put my thing in her. That was a while back --

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: So long as you vow to change your ways.

dialogues.speaker: UNFERTH
dialogues.text: Oh, y'know I'll try, right, but... Brendan sighs. WITH: Beowulf standing with a slightly-drunk Hrothgar and sober Wealhtheow.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: These gifts won't bring you back your friend, but they might show his family our endless thanks.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: They'd welcome that tales were told of him here. That beers were raised -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 98.

dialogues.speaker: WEALHTHEOW
dialogues.text: (loaded) His name will hold fast. This land's seen a fear far worse than Huns or Hathobards. We've pissed our beds, buried our children. Our boys dreaded growing. Our men are walking ghosts. (beat) We can never thank you enough. Wealhtheow kisses Beowulf firmly on the mouth. Beowulf awkwardly accepts the gesture. Wealhtheow turns and continues away. Beowulf looks to Hrothgar, who gives a shrug.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Most women would've let me sink.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Odin as well. Beowulf turns, sees Brendan several feet back. Beowulf ey him hard.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I can't say how things go in the South, but in the North, creeping up can earn you your death.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I took this for a feast of friends.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Then don't scoff at gods that welcome yours. Brendan, perturbed, faintly bows to Hrothgar, withdraws.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Go easy, he's harmless. Hrothgar grabs a jug and fills up both their cups.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: To the end of gloom! Beowulf forces a smile, joins Hrothgar in a gulp. WITH: Breca and Thorfinn staring up at the arm. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 Beowulf

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 99.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Where's the arm-ring? I wanted that arm-ring.

dialogues.speaker: THORFINN
dialogues.text: He didn't have an arm-ring.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Sure he did. Listen, the fucker near snapped my neck. Figured the least thing I'd get would be the arm-ring.

dialogues.speaker: THORFINN
dialogues.text: Smell like him it's all yours. WITH: Beowulf and Hrothgar, Hrothgar determined to enjoy himself.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: I don't think I'm the worst king...

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Not at all --

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: -.-when I think of the others. Martin Longsword the Saxon has a long sword but no brain. Half his kin ran to Angle-land. Six-tooth Peter of the Slavs can't keep his warriors from fighting each other. (beat / smiles) Then... yeah... then there's Sig!

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Sig?

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Sig Skullsplitter of the Hathobards. You don't know Sig? You haven't heard of Sig?!

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Something... I don't know... with sheep?

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Good God, man! Sheep are just the tip of it. They say he tried a dead walrus once... he's tried horses... he's tried goats. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 119 120 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 100

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (edging hysterical) They say he tried it once with a rabbit... and got stuck --

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Stuck?!

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Yeah! So when he comes to fight, it's on six legs... and you want to see fast?! Hrothgar roars with LAUGHTER, Beowulf laughing as well. Tears start streaming from Hrothgar's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: (between laughs) I tell you... I tell you... if he ever comes here again, I'll send out a batch of squirrels! That'll slow him...! More hysterical laughter and tears... and gradually the m of humour falls... and Hrothgar is reduced to tearful gasps... the fear climbing back into his eyes. Beowulf pats his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: It's over now. The troll's dead. Wealhtheow comes up, sees Hrothgar's state.

dialogues.speaker: WEALHTHEOW
dialogues.text: Dear, come on. Lie down a bit. There'll be many nights now to drink. She trades a look with Beowulf, and steers Hrothgar away. Beowulf looks over the gathering, smiles... but it's wear and bittersweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf, with a few drinks in him, emerges from the smoky hall and sucks in the fresher air. He looks around, lost... and a little drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf rides into the clearing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 10

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Selma, at her firepit, takes up a stick and stirs up the embers. Beowulf dismounts. Approaches the fire. She glances at hi completely neutral - then back to the fire.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (after a beat) So... is this more or less as you saw it? With Grendel?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I saw you more bloodied.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Luck stood at my side.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Luck can be a whore too. (beat) So... aren't you missing the meal?

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Guess I'm missing my best friend more.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Hondscioh. (off his nod) And one Geat life's worth - what? - two Danes...? Three Swedes...? Ten trolls? (off Beowulf's stare) Hondscioh's life had worth to you, since you knew him. Others know others. A long beat. A realization comes to Beowulf.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: You mourn the troll.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: I knew him. As she stirs her fire...

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 121 122 123 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 102

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS: a huge lava field, the forms eerily suggestin hundreds of figures frozen in the light...

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: We'd all heard tales when we were kids... later, we learned that most were told to keep us out of streams in the spring... or clear of icebergs when they were calving. The wilds were harsh, you could wander lost for days... so they told us trolls lived there... (beat) ...but they did. A shape in the middle distance abruptly turns, rises: it' Grendel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selma - half-a-dozen years younger - lies in bed, edging sleep. Only the sound of the WIND and the SEA... Then the CREAK of her door edging open. Selma turns, sees ..-Grendel slowly fill the doorway, enter the hut, sniff around, eye her.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: One night Grendel found my hut. Grendel crosses the room, huge, hulking... and MUTTERING low apology. Selma, petrified, closes her eyes, mutters prayers, curle beneath her blanket. Grendel reaches out and pulls back the blanket, pulls Sel up by the hips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf stares down into the embers... Selma stirring the with a stick. She throws on more peat, and as the smoke rises...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 124 125 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 103

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel is methodically thrusting into Selma from behind. She is crying quietly, gasping, her eyes wide in confusio Grendel climaxes with little apparent emotion - just a fe breaths heavier than previously - then he places Selma ba on her bed, face-down, and pulls the blanket back up over her. Selma remains where she is, in shock... but no longer cry only softly panting from the effort, and the fear as it e away... her eyes wide... .---and, as Grendel's breathing also softens, there comes CREAKING steps of his exit... В«.-the door opening... SOUNDS of the wind and sea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selma is placing sticks on the fire. She glances up at Beowulf.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Thing is, he never took me again.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Then why did he keep coming?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Keep the Danes away. The ones who'd fuck me then cut my throat.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Show me them.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: They're mostly gone now.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (dismissive) Everywhere there's wretches... no more here than --

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: Yes. Some of Hrothgar's best. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 125 126 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 104

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beowulf sees her now in profile, her eyes wet, her skin shimmering in the flicker of fire-light. Her beauty. He edges up to her. She turns, studies him, then backhands him hard in the fa He staggers back a step, more stunned than offended.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Where did that have its birth?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: You thinking you can tie me up and drag me like a dog. (beat) Don't forget. I know how you die. Beowulf is jolted. Almost as much as when she rises up to him and kisses him - hard. They tentatively reach for each other. She abruptly pulls him to her, driving her face along the sides of his throat, feeling his hair against her cheek. He kisses her face and she swings her mouth to his - kiss him hungrily. As their hands explore each other's bodies... Selma works her way across his chest - the first time she had this control in years - if ever at all.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (wry) Been a while?

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: With men... yeah. Beowulf gets it like the slap. She laughs. She steers him back onto a bench, then raises her skirt a straddles his lap. He kisses back - finally getting the picture - and they t into each other... fiercely, rather like animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All seems quiet but for... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 126 127 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 105

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: --.in the middle distance, a couple of GUARDS, who are slightly drunk, jovial, relieved finally after all this time... In the foreground, Brendan shuffles along, loose with drink...

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I'm tellnya, Christ, y'thought the Celts were work... But these - it's one hand on their sword, the other on their dick... Which hand they'll use to cross themselves, I almost fear to ask... He looks up from the ground just as... ---a huge HAND sweeps out from the dark at him... .---and slaps his face... SNAPPING his neck. He spins a step or so in a deadman's dance - then collaps to the ground. And a great SHAPE moves over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The oak doors edge open, and a [two-armed] troll edges in CLOSE ON: the shadowed face as it SNIFFS. Fierce black ey scan. As the troll moves into the light from the fire-pit ember her breasts are discernible beneath her hide-shift, as is wild and grizzled mane: it's Grendel's mother - the SEA-H She's the same genesis as Grendel, slightly smaller - but with greater vengeance. Bronze snaking arm-rings encircle her powerful forearms. She edges between the sleeping warriors, more cautious th her son, till her eyes alight on... -.--Grendel's arm nailed to the rafters. Grief is quickly overwhelmed by fury. She tears the arm d off its spike. As she turns... ...the WARRIOR nearest to her stirs and looks up. She gra him by the throat, SHRIEKS, and throws him into the fire- A SECOND WARRIOR rises. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 128 129 130 131 132 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 106

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She swings her son's arm, clubbing the man to death. As the warriors now struggle out of sleep, she strides purposely for the door, her son's arm clutched under her As she nears the door, Aeschere steps in front of her, sw drawn, blocking her path.

dialogues.speaker: AESCHERE
dialogues.text: Learn from your child, hag! He swings his sword with all the strength he can muster.. ..-but she blocks it with her son's arm, the blade lodgin the flesh. She snatches hold of Aeschere, and pulls him t her in a lethal hug... the SOUND of his bones SNAPPING as does...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LS: of the Sea-Hag lurching out of the hall, one arm carr Grendel's arm, the other dragging a corpse by the hair. As she disappears into the dark... REVEAL THE POV: as that of the feral child, hiding in nea rocks. He pulls back and scurries away... +--as wails and commotion rise from the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selma jerks up to sitting in her bed... ..-finding the feral boy standing over her, fear on his face... ..-while Beowulf sleeps on, beside Selma. Selma hurriedly dresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wild-eyed Hrothgar, barefoot, in his nightclothes, is moving through the mess of furniture and bodies. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 132 133 134 135 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 107

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Aeschere! Aeschere! Hrothgar's roaming gaze fixes on... -.-an arm protruding from a shadowed corner, the hand clenched to a splendid sword. Hrothgar recognizes it immediately. He bends, reaches for the arm... ---and that is entirely what he gets: Aeschere's arm torn from its socket... and no body in sight. Hrothgar gasps horror, drops the arm, and staggers back, eyes glazing in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLUSTER of Geat horsemen wait while... .--Beowulf straps on his gear, Breca beside him.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (to Breca) We lose anymore? Breca shakes his head, then indicates Unferth.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: But they did. Unferth strides about the clearing, torch in hand, fierce staring into the dark. He turns to the hut and starts setting it afire. As the fire rises, Beowulf and Breca share a weary look, their eyes. Unferth vigorously swings the torch in the sign of the cr

dialogues.speaker: UNFERTH
dialogues.text: (incensed) By the holy word of Christ, never again shall evil dwell here! By the holy word of Christ, never again shall evil dwell here! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 135 136 137 138 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 108

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beowulf mounts his horse.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: (low to Beowulf) That what we got to look forward to?

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Maybe he'll go south. And the two men lead the others away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the brutal landscape... ..--Beowulf, Unferth, and the band of Geat warriors follo blood-trail on horseback...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warriors come down to the beach on which they previou found the bloody signs of Grendel's death-throes. This ti they come upon... В«+-a blood-caked HEAD, propped on a stick. Breca rides u looks it over, turns back to Beowulf.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: It's Aeschere. Unferth bolts forth on his horse, dismounts hurriedly, dr his sword and waves it at the beach.

dialogues.speaker: UNFERTH
dialogues.text: Aeschere! We will right this wrong! God will burn this devil- bitch-fiend! Breca eyes Beowulf who ever-so-slightly rolls his eyes. Beowulf's scanning gaze finds... ...the entrance to a cave which opens on the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The troop move through the damp cave through which a wate filled crevice runs, searching but finding no evidence of Grendel or the hag. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 138 139 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 109

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Nothing lives here. They're about to leave, when Beowulf fixes on... ..-where the crevice meets the sloping ceiling of the cav He bends low, peers along the water's edge. He climbs dow into the water.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Beowulf?
