dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Cave doesn't end here. There's outflow... (indicates the cave-wall) +..from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: I'll go. Beowulf shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: You can't swim for shit. They trade a smile. Beowulf takes a deep breath, and descends into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf makes his way along the murky channel, the ceilin most a foot above the water, in many spots entirely submerged... В«--the only light filtering up through the water from th cave. A wash of water smacks him against the rock. He gulps water - chokes - gasps for air. Clinging to an outcrop, he regains his breath. Continues The ceiling now descends a foot into the water. But - through the murk - he can make out some form of BLU LIGHT bleeding through the water from beyond the next roc He steels himself, takes the deepest breath he can, then dives down into the water, legs furiously kicking...  140 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 110

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf bursts up out of the water... ...into an ice-cave, through one wall of which the outsid light faintly glows. Cautiously he edges out of the water, onto the sand. Against one wall is a pile of treasure, gilded weapons, shields, and the skeleton heads of humans... He continues on into the semi-dark of a rock passage and almost stumbles over... ...Grendel's corpse. The arm-socket wound has been sealed with pitch... but too late for Grendel. Blood saturates t sand. A few feet away lies the great torn-off arm. Beowulf turns the head by its hair, peers into the face.. ...when a SHRIEK comes from behind. He wheels... .--and the Sea-Hag is upon him. She wildly claws at him with one hand, while trying to st him with the knife she holds in the other. Beowulf breaks free of her, swings with his sword, but it hardly cuts through the walrus-hide. She strikes out and her fingernails tear across his ribs. falls into the water, and she leaps upon him. They wrestle, twisting under the surface... ...then rise, Beowulf having slipped behind her and taken hold of her hands... She lurches backwards, smashing him against the rocks... As his grip loosens, she swings him partway in front of h slashes down one arm with her knife... and his blood pour from the wound... Beowulf stumbles clear of the Sea-Hag, eyes... +--a giant's sword in the treasure pile, of which he take hold. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 140 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 111

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Sea-Hag rushes toward him... .-.-and he only has time to swing the blade upward... ...Slashing across her neck and face. She SCREECHES pain, twists about, eyes going blind, and collapses into the water... ..-blood gushing from her and staining the water.. +-+-as Beowulf collapses in the sand. Beowulf trudges back to Grendel's corpse, stands over it. ..-when he hears a sound - a living GASP - from behind hi He wheels around... ...but the Sea-Hag lies where she was, half her body in t water, the other half in the sand. Beowulf leaves Grendel, edges past the fire-pit toward th darker recesses of the cave. Edging around a rock, he sees... В«..the GLIMMER of a blade, and raises his own, prepared strike. As he moves another step forward, he's confronted by... CLOSE ON: the feral boy, hiding in the rocks, holding a dagger out at Beowulf, terror in his tear-ridden eyes... ..-but the boy then charges wildly, slashing with his dag Beowulf shifts clear of the charge... ---and the child continues over to the body of Grendel, w he wheels around, squats down, dagger extended, protectin the corpse. Beowulf studies him a beat, Beowulf's sword still raised.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Your father. It's unclear if it's a challenge or only confirmation. The child, sensing it's the former, swallows, then defian nods, preparing to be attacked. Beowulf, eyes still frenzied, blinks through the blood on face. Shakes the dizziness from his head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 140 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 112

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wipes the blood from his eyes with his arm... and now cle sees the child's fear. He stares dully a long beat... his mind twisting around o itself. Finally he softens, sighs, lets his sword drop to his side.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then you can be proud. The two study each other a beat... ...then Beowulf turns, starts back toward the water. A GASP to one side of Beowulf. He twists around to find.. ...the Sea-Hag, eyes blood-blinded, trudging slowly towar him. He raises his sword, point held outward. The Sea-Hag slows to a teetering stop several feet from h Her bloody hands vaguely explore the air before her. Beowulf's expression softens... ---and, in that moment, one of her hands snaps out, and g hold of the extended blade. Beowulf, transfixed, holds his ground. The Sea-Hag then - incrementally - edges forward till the blade-point touches her abdomen. She lets out a painful breath. And then, teeth clenched, she edges forward again. She lets out a GASP as the sword penetrates her skin. Her head falls back, the wild hair shifting off her face, revealing features of fierce beauty. Beowulf - overwhelmed and transfixed - lets go of the swo and shifts out of the way. The Sea-Hag continues forward. Finally, the sword-hilt me the wall of the cave. She feels the resistance... ..-drags in a breath... ...then pushes forward, the sword moving through her, and emerging out her back. She sighs, staggers a couple steps, then falls back dead, into the water. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 140 141 142 143 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 113

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON: Beowulf, mesmerized. He looks over... ...to Grendel's corpse and finds the child is gone. Beowulf drops to a sitting position in the sand, his bloo hands dangling off his bloody knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breca is grimly peering down into the water, through whic shadow of blood now runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unferth is on his horse... but the other Geat warriors ha yet to mount theirs.

dialogues.speaker: UNFERTH
dialogues.text: What do I do - come back for you tomorrow? (off their looks) You'll never find your way in the dark. But the Geats aren't budging. Unferth shakes his head wit derision - but remains.

dialogues.speaker: UNFERTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As you wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breca has built a small cairn of rocks on the sand. He ceremoniously drives his sword down into the sand before A SPLASH behind him. Breca wheels to find... ..-Beowulf's head break the surface of the water. Beowulf gasps air, blinks his eyes clear, sees Breca - an smiles. Breca scrambles over and gives him a hand up.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Her blood then? Beowulf nods, then his gaze settles on the cairn of stone

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: (superstitious) What the fuck's that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 145A
dialogues.text: Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 114

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Breca boots over the cairn, pulls his sword free.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Just killing time. And the two shuffle out towards the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A subdued procession of torch-lit Geats continues back to Heorot... ..-Beowulf holding Aeschere's severed head in his hands.. .--another horse carrying the headless corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is assembled for the pyre-burning of Aeschere. * Surrounding the body are weapons, armour, and other gifts Hrothgar comes up beside Beowulf.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: Valkyries will have their hands * full with that old goat. * Beowulf smiles, nods.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to have brought you to all this.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: We brought ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: At least now it's over. Beowulf doesn't contradict him.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That Celtic priest said I'd be forgiven. I just need to hook the right god. (wry look / beat) You ever worry on that? Heaven. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 146 147 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 115

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I'm thinking I'll probably go where I'm sent. Hrothgar considers, nods. They share hard-won smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beowulf rides slowly along on horseback, scanning the roc outcrops... and WHISTLING a broken tune. A WHISTLE comes back from over a ridge... Beowulf stops, lets the silence settle a beat, whistles again... .---and, again, the whistle comes back. Beowulf turns his horse off the trail and starts up the ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH: Beowulf as he climbs up through forbidding rock... .+-which opens into a small meadow in which he sees... -.-Selma, constructing a new camp. As he approaches, she pays little attention... a glance, best.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: You could've killed me the other night.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: I know. I was horny. Beowulf is once-again blindsided by her. He smiles, shake his head.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's not me who does it. A chill runs through Beowulf. He broods a beat.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anything else you need to know? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 147 148 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 116

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: How you'll get along. (off her look) I mean without an eight-foot troll to keep the dregs away. (off her shrug) You know they'll kill your son if they find him. Selma savages some wood with her axe.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: You couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: I'm not them.

dialogues.speaker: SELMA
dialogues.text: No. You just killed his father. (beat) Hrothgar taught you nothing I guess. Beowulf considers this a bit. He moves towards her, raise hand to touch her... but she moves out of reach. She picks up a bucket and strides off across the meadow.. .--Beowulf - torn - watching her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beach on which Grendel died. Just above the high-tide line, a bonfire burns. PULL BACK / REVEAL: Beowulf steadying the last few rocks shoulder-high cairn. He stands back from it, considers it a beat. Through the smoke twisting around him, he "sees" without directly loo up... +.-mMovement in the rocks above him to one side. He draws his sword, cuts off a braid of hair, and throws onto the fire. He then drives his sword down into the sand at the base o the cairn. Drops to his knees before it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 148 149 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 117

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: Sleep, Grendel. CLOSE ON: the feral boy, eyes tearing, watching the cerem for his dead father.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 14
dialogues.text: As Beowulf's longship moves out of the harbour... ..-Beowulf stands with Breca and Thorfinn at the bow look out over the water. Thorkel stands at the stern, facing the rowers, a Christi cross at his throat...

dialogues.speaker: THORKEL
dialogues.text: ..-born of scum and swampy things / Lurking in his mother's moss / The mark of Cain came to his brow / Of evil and a sea-hag born / Grendel, grinder of lost men's bones / Felt hate toward the happy Danes... WITH: Breca watching Thorkel...

dialogues.speaker: THORFINN
dialogues.text: Cain... what's that?

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Man who killed his brother in a Christian tale.

dialogues.speaker: THORFINN
dialogues.text: What's Cain got to do with Grendel? (off Breca's shrug) Grendel kill his own brother too?

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: No, I think Thorkel's saying that Grendel's just like Cain - a killer.

dialogues.speaker: THORFINN
dialogues.text: We all are.

dialogues.speaker: BRECA
dialogues.text: Yeah well...

dialogues.speaker: THORFINN
dialogues.text: Thorkel's tale is shit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 149 Beowulf & Grendel - 10th dr. - Berzins - July 12/04 - 118

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beowulf looks across to the shore, and sees through the fog... ...the feral child following along the rocks. Beowulf watches as... ...the child comes to the end of the rocky spit. The fog clears enough to reveal, on the rocks several feet above him... ...Selma standing, driftwood in hand, also watching them CLOSE ON: her face... and the ghost of a smile. The fog thickens, mother and child disappearing into the land. Beowulf blinks, his eyes now watering. He wipes them, loo again... ..-but there's nothing visible but rock and water. Beowulf turns his grim gaze back to the sea.

dialogues.speaker: BEOWULF
dialogues.text: By Odin's will... Unexpectedly to Beowulf, a chorus of voices of the other Geats rise in the prayer:

dialogues.speaker: UNISON
dialogues.text: ---let us find our way home. Beowulf looks out over the others, all of whom are fixed him. He nods, and turns his gaze... ++-back out on the sea. FADE OUT.
